text: Why does python use two underscores for certain things?
I'm fairly new to actual programming languages, and Python is my first one.
I know my way around Linux a bit, enough to get a summer job with it (I'm still in high school), and on the job, I have a lot of free time which I'm using to learn Python.
One thing's been getting me though.
What exactly is different in Python when you have expressions such as
I know what methods do and stuff, and I get what they do, but my question is: How are those double underscore methods above different from their simpler looking equivalents?
P.S., I don't mind being lectured on programming history, in fact, I find it very useful to know :) If these are mainly historical aspects of Python, feel free to start rambling.
